name: Lemon-Dill Rainbow Trout with Brown Basmati Rice and Roasted Asparagus
description: Oven-roasted rainbow trout with dill and lemon, paired with fluffy brown basmati rice and crisp roasted asparagus. A mild, protein-forward family dinner done in under an hour.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a large baking tray with foil or baking paper.
Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear.
Finely chop dill and mince garlic.
Pat rainbow trout dry with paper towels.
Zest the lemon, then cut it in half (reserve one half for juice, slice the other half for garnish).
cook_steps: Add rinsed brown basmati rice and 3 cups water with a big pinch of salt to a saucepan; bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 25–30 minutes until tender. Keep covered to steam 5 minutes off heat.
On the lined tray, toss asparagus with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Roast 12–15 minutes until crisp-tender; push to one side of the tray.

Place trout fillets skin-side down on the cleared side of the tray. Drizzle with 2 tbsp olive oil, sprinkle minced garlic, most of the chopped dill, salt, and black pepper. Lay a few lemon slices on top.
Roast trout 8–10 minutes until it flakes easily with a fork (thicker fillets may need up to 12 minutes).
Fluff the cooked rice with a fork; fold in lemon zest and a squeeze of lemon juice. Adjust salt and pepper.
Plate rice, top with trout, and serve with roasted asparagus. Finish with remaining dill and an extra squeeze of lemon to taste.
